displayStatus.description: The short localizable label for the status.

message.description: The detailed status message, including for alerts and error messages.

virtualMachines.description: A list of references to all virtual machines in the availability set.

managed.description: If the availability set supports managed disks.

AvailabilitySetProperties.description: The instance view of a resource.

AvailabilitySet.description: Create or update availability set parameters.

AvailabilitySetListResult.description: The List Availability Set operation response.

name.description: The name of the virtual machine size.

numberOfCores.description: The number of cores supported by the virtual machine size.

osDiskSizeInMB.description: The OS disk size, in MB, allowed by the virtual machine size.

resourceDiskSizeInMB.description: The resource disk size, in MB, allowed by the virtual machine size.

memoryInMB.description: The amount of memory, in MB, supported by the virtual machine size.

maxDataDiskCount.description: The maximum number of data disks that can be attached to the virtual machine size.

VirtualMachineSize.description: Describes the properties of a VM size.

value.description: The list of virtual machine sizes.

VirtualMachineSizeListResult.description: The List Virtual Machine operation response.

operatingSystem.description: The operating system this extension supports.

computeRole.description: The type of role (IaaS or PaaS) this extension supports.

handlerSchema.description: The schema defined by publisher, where extension consumers should provide settings in a matching schema.

vmScaleSetEnabled.description: Whether the extension can be used on xRP VMScaleSets. By default existing extensions are usable on scalesets, but there might be cases where a publisher wants to explicitly indicate the extension is only enabled for CRP VMs but not VMSS.

supportsMultipleExtensions.description: Whether the handler can support multiple extensions.

VirtualMachineExtensionImageProperties.description: Describes the properties of a Virtual Machine Extension Image.

VirtualMachineExtensionImage.description: Describes a Virtual Machine Extension Image.

location.description: The supported Azure location of the resource.

tags.description: The tags attached to the resource.

type.description: The full type of the extension handler which includes both publisher and type.

typeHandlerVersion.description: The type version of the extension handler.

VirtualMachineExtensionInstanceView.description: The instance view of a virtual machine extension.

forceUpdateTag.description: How the extension handler should be forced to update even if the extension configuration has not changed.

publisher.description: The name of the extension handler publisher.

type.description: The type of the extension handler.

typeHandlerVersion.description: The type version of the extension handler.

autoUpgradeMinorVersion.description: Whether the extension handler should be automatically upgraded across minor versions.

settings.description: Json formatted public settings for the extension.

protectedSettings.description: Json formatted protected settings for the extension.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state, which only appears in the response.

instanceView.description: The virtual machine extension instance view.

VirtualMachineExtensionProperties.description: Describes the properties of a Virtual Machine Extension.

PurchasePlan.description: Used for establishing the purchase context of any 3rd Party artifact through MarketPlace.

operatingSystem.description: The operating system of the osDiskImage.

OSDiskImage.description: Contains the os disk image information.

lun.description: The LUN number for a data disk. This value is used to identify data disk image inside the VMImage and therefore it must be unique for each data disk.

DataDiskImage.description: Contains the data disk images information.

VirtualMachineImageProperties.description: Describes the properties of a Virtual Machine Image.

localizedValue.description: The localized name of the resource.

unit.description: An enum describing the unit of usage measurement.

currentValue.description: The current usage of the resource.

limit.description: The maximum permitted usage of the resource.

name.description: The name of the type of usage.

value.description: The list of compute resource usages.

nextLink.description: The URI to fetch the next page of compute resource usage information. Call ListNext() with this to fetch the next page of compute resource usage information.

vhdPrefix.description: The captured virtual hard disk's name prefix.

overwriteVhds.description: Specifies whether to overwrite the destination virtual hard disk, in case of conflict.

version.description: The image version. The allowed formats are Major.Minor.Build or 'latest'. Major, Minor and Build are decimal numbers. Specify 'latest' to use the latest version of the image.

secretUrl.description: The URL referencing a secret in a Key Vault.

sourceVault.description: The relative URL of the Key Vault containing the secret.

KeyVaultSecretReference.description: Describes a reference to Key Vault Secret

keyUrl.description: The URL referencing a key in a Key Vault.

sourceVault.description: The relative URL of the Key Vault containing the key.

KeyVaultKeyReference.description: Describes a reference to Key Vault Key

diskEncryptionKey.description: The disk encryption key which is a Key Vault Secret.

keyEncryptionKey.description: The key encryption key which is Key Vault Key.

enabled.description: Specifies whether disk encryption should be enabled on the virtual machine.

DiskEncryptionSettings.description: Describes a Encryption Settings for a Disk

uri.description: The virtual hard disk's URI. Must be a valid URI to a virtual hard disk.

VirtualHardDisk.description: Describes the uri of a disk.

ManagedDiskParameters.description: The parameters of a managed disk.

image.description: The source user image virtual hard disk. The virtual hard disk will be copied before using it to attach to the virtual machine. If SourceImage is provided, the destination virtual hard disk must not exist.

diskSizeGB.description: The initial disk size, in GB, for blank data disks, and the new desired size for resizing existing OS and data disks.

image.description: The source user image virtual hard disk. This virtual hard disk will be copied before using it to attach to the virtual machine. If SourceImage is provided, the destination virtual hard disk must not exist.

diskSizeGB.description: The initial disk size in GB for blank data disks, and the new desired size for resizing existing OS and data disks.

passName.description: The pass name. Currently, the only allowable value is oobeSystem.

componentName.description: The component name. Currently, the only allowable value is Microsoft-Windows-Shell-Setup.

content.description: XML formatted content that is added to the unattend.xml file in the specified pass and component. The XML must be less than 4 KB and must include the root element for the setting or feature that is being inserted.

AdditionalUnattendContent.description: Additional XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file, which is used by Windows Setup. Contents are defined by setting name, component name, and the pass in which the content is a applied.

protocol.description: The Protocol used by the WinRM listener. Http and Https are supported.

certificateUrl.description: The Certificate URL in KMS for Https listeners. Should be null for Http listeners.

WinRMListener.description: Describes Protocol and thumbprint of Windows Remote Management listener

listeners.description: The list of Windows Remote Management listeners

WinRMConfiguration.description: Describes Windows Remote Management configuration of the VM

provisionVMAgent.description: Indicates whether the virtual machine agent should be provisioned on the Virtual Machine. If not specified, then the default behavior is to set it to true.

enableAutomaticUpdates.description: Indicates whether Windows updates are automatically installed on the VM.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the VM

additionalUnattendContent.description: Additional base-64 encoded XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file.

winRM.description: The Windows Remote Management configuration of the VM

WindowsConfiguration.description: Describes Windows Configuration of the OS Profile.

path.description: Specifies the full path on the created VM where SSH public key is stored. If the file already exists, the specified key is appended to the file.

keyData.description: Certificate public key used to authenticate to the VM through SSH. The certificate must be in Pem format with or without headers.

SshPublicKey.description: Contains information about SSH certificate public key and the path on the Linux VM where the public key is placed.

publicKeys.description: The list of SSH public keys used to authenticate with linux based VMs.

SshConfiguration.description: SSH configuration for Linux based VMs running on Azure

disablePasswordAuthentication.description: Specifies whether password authentication should be disabled.

ssh.description: The SSH configuration for linux VMs.

LinuxConfiguration.description: Describes Windows configuration of the OS Profile.

certificateUrl.description: The URL referencing a secret in a Key Vault which contains a properly formatted certificate.

certificateStore.description: The Certificate store in LocalMachine to add the certificate to on Windows, leave empty on Linux.

VaultCertificate.description: Describes a single certificate reference in a Key Vault, and where the certificate should reside on the VM.

sourceVault.description: The Relative URL of the Key Vault containing all of the certificates in VaultCertificates.

vaultCertificates.description: The list of key vault references in SourceVault which contain certificates.

VaultSecretGroup.description: Describes a set of certificates which are all in the same Key Vault.

computerName.description: Specifies the host OS name of the virtual machine.

adminUsername.description: Specifies the name of the administrator account.

adminPassword.description: Specifies the password of the administrator account.

customData.description: Specifies a base-64 encoded string of custom data. The base-64 encoded string is decoded to a binary array that is saved as a file on the Virtual Machine. The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes

windowsConfiguration.description: The Windows configuration of the OS profile.

linuxConfiguration.description: The Linux configuration of the OS profile.

secrets.description: The list of certificates for addition to the VM.

primary.description: Specifies the primary network interface in case the virtual machine has more than 1 network interface.

NetworkInterfaceReferenceProperties.description: Describes a network interface reference properties.

networkInterfaces.description: Specifies the list of resource IDs for the network interfaces associated with the virtual machine.

enabled.description: Whether boot diagnostics should be enabled on the Virtual Machine.

storageUri.description: URI of the storage account to use for placing the console output and screenshot.

bootDiagnostics.description: Boot Diagnostics is a debugging feature which allows the user to view console output and/or a screenshot of the virtual machine from the hypervisor.

type.description: Full type of the extension handler which includes both publisher and type.

typeHandlerVersion.description: The type version of the extension handler.

VirtualMachineExtensionHandlerInstanceVi.description: The instance view of a virtual machine extension handler.

extensionHandlers.description: The virtual machine extension handler instance view.

VirtualMachineAgentInstanceView.description: The instance view of the VM Agent running on the virtual machine.

DiskInstanceView.description: The instance view of the disk.

serialConsoleLogBlobUri.description: The Linux serial console log blob Uri.

BootDiagnosticsInstanceView.description: The instance view of a virtual machine boot diagnostics.

principalId.description: The principal id of virtual machine identity.

tenantId.description: The tenant id associated with the virtual machine.

type.description: The type of identity used for the virtual machine. Currently, the only supported type is 'SystemAssigned', which implicitly creates an identity.

isCustomerInitiatedMaintenanceAllowed.description: True, if customer is allowed to perform Maintenance.

preMaintenanceWindowStartTime.description: Start Time for the Pre Maintenance Window.

preMaintenanceWindowEndTime.description: End Time for the Pre Maintenance Window.

maintenanceWindowStartTime.description: Start Time for the Maintenance Window.

maintenanceWindowEndTime.description: End Time for the Maintenance Window.

lastOperationResultCode.description: The Last Maintenance Operation Result Code.

lastOperationMessage.description: Message returned for the last Maintenance Operation.

platformUpdateDomain.description: Specifies the update domain of the virtual machine.

platformFaultDomain.description: Specifies the fault domain of the virtual machine.

vmAgent.description: The VM Agent running on the virtual machine.

maintenanceRedeployStatus.description: The Maintenance Operation status on the virtual machine.

VirtualMachineInstanceView.description: The instance view of a virtual machine.

availabilitySet.description: The reference Id of the availability set to which the virtual machine belongs.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state, which only appears in the response.

licenseType.description: Specifies that the image or disk that is being used was licensed on-premises. This element is only used for images that contain the Windows Server operating system.

vmId.description: Specifies the VM unique ID which is a 128-bits identifier that is encoded and stored in all Azure IaaS VMs SMBIOS and can be read using platform BIOS commands.

VirtualMachineProperties.description: Describes the properties of a Virtual Machine.

plan.description: The purchase plan when deploying virtual machine from VM Marketplace images.

resources.description: The virtual machine child extension resources.

identity.description: The identity of the virtual machine, if configured.

nextLink.description: The URI to fetch the next page of VMs. Call ListNext() with this URI to fetch the next page of Virtual Machines.
